timeline.message: wildcard field tests for terms agg
Add tests for wildcard agg support

timeline.bodyText:
I think Optional prefers things to look like:
RandomIndexWriter indexWriter = indexWriterConfg.map(c -> new RandomIndexWriter(random(), directory, c).orElseGet(() -> new RandomIndexWriter(random(), directory);
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Yeah, I agree that's what Optional would like this to look like.  Unfortunately, new RandomIndexWriter can throw an IOException, and the lambda Optional#map and friends expect is declared to not throw.  I could do something to wrap and throw an unchecked exception, but I think it'd be less clear than just using the if/else block.  Open to suggestions if you know a way to do this that isn't terrible.
replies.author: not-napoleon

timeline.bodyText: This says "when I don't tell you what analyzer to use then use the wildcard analyzer". I believe Elasticsearch always sets the analyzer. The wildcard field mapper looks like it does. I don't think either test needs this.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: (StringTerms results) -> should do the same thing with a little less ceremony.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Could you try running with aggregateAfter set? I think that'd be useful to make sure works as well.
timeline.author: nik9000
nik9000
